name: green spot next to river
description: Off the main road you go offroad. After a few meters you will see a green field. With a trailer we could also turn easily. The field is next to a river. A few locals walked by, it was no problem to stay overnight.

name: Camp near Prizren
description: Camp on the roadside on the way to Prizren. During night not loud. Occasionally cars passing by on the road which is one level higher. On the other side is a small river.

name: Parking close to center in Pristina
description: parked and slept here from sat. to sund. it was ok, not too loud and they charged us 4€ for more than 24 hours. other parkings close to the center are more expensive. there is 24h guarding.

name: Other side of river
description: This camp is on the other side of the river to the other one marked.  It's more secluded and out of the sight of the road.  Need to cross river but river was below concrete crossing when we were there.  Still loads of rubbish on this side too.  No facilities.  Free.

name: Guri i Kuq
description: The friendly people of restaurant/villas Guru I Kuq allowed me, and later an other camper, to camp on their ground. For € 2,50 per person you get access to the bathroom of one of the villas. The restaurant has a nice setting and ambiance and serves the usual food as everywhere in the Balkans but also local trout, all for very reasonable prices. You can make a nice hike to a nearby lake, the staff of the restaurant will be happy to give you the directions

name: Car insurance for Kosovo
description:
Car insurance for kosovo (as it is not included in european green card).
They asked me 138 euros for my Van for 15 days... (and I planned to stay 3 days...). So we didn't go to Kosovo... Maybe it is less expensive for small cars.

name: 24hour secure parking
description:
Secure parking spot for 2€ close to town. We can stay here for the night. Water should be available. No toilets!
Restaurants nearby.

name: secured carpark close to center
description:
Secured carpark close to center. Well lit, but couldnot see cameras. It is a place for people to park, when they go out at night. 1€/hour,or 10€ for the night.
Not a bargain, but seems well organiced and very central.
Water available.
Narrow road to reach it! Be careful with big rigs! Depends on parking cars in the streets.

name: Guri I Zi
description: A nice hotel not far from the Kosovo/Montenegro border. What caught our attention were the hotel’s carnival rides out front (bumper cars, spinning swing thing - all shut off after around 6), but found the restaurant to have fantastic food with very reasonable prices (the local trout is superb). There is a nice veranda along a river behind the hotel and many other shaded areas around the property. All the staff were kind and welcoming. We paid €20 for 2 people in a double room.

name: Kosovo/Montenegro border
description: Easy border crossing (either country several kilometres from the actual border). All nationalities accepted. Green card not valid in Kosovo. Kosovo insurance for 15 days (minimum) for €15 available at the border.

name: Town Hostel
description:
very nice new modern hostel 
12€ shared room 
safe parking for 2 motorbike I think

name: The White Tree Hostel
description:
Very nice hostel for 8€.
Shared room.
Parking for the bike.
also have a bar for a nice beer for 1€.

name: Border Serbia & Kosovo
description: Easy to pass. We paid 10€ insurance for the bike. The whole procedure took 10 minutes.

name: Hillside
description: Beautiful camp spot with view on the surrounding mountains. You can be seen from the road and nearby houses but nobody bothered us here. Also almost no traffic on this road.Can be a little bit windy but we didn't have any problems with our rooftoptents.

name: Bear sanctuary
description:
You can camp for free on the big parkinglot at the Bear sanctuary. very friendly staff, they speak good english.
You can use the toilets of the restaurant. Free wifi at the restaurant, playground for the kids.
busy in daytime but then very quiet at night.
The bear  sanctuary is really worth a visit. They rescued bears from restaurant holders in Kosovo and Albania.
Also a grass field for people with a tent.
Food in the restaurant is delicious and cheap.

name: Toyota garage
description: Very helpfull and good service. Staff speaks good english.

name: view over Rugova canyon
description:
Beautiful camp spot with view over the mountains and Rugova canyon. Different  campspots on the grassfield . 
very quiet at night and we didn't saw anyone around here. Just some abonded houses

name: Gropa Erenikit
description:
Big flat grassfield where you can camp. The village is more a village of summerhouses from people of the city. They send us here to camp. Further up more campspots.
From this place you can start the dayhike to Gjeravica. The highest peak from Kosovo and Gjeravica lake. The trail from this place is not marked and not always good visible. You have to find your way up with the trail on maps. At the top you can go down to the lake. This trail is really good marked. Also more people on this trail. Most people hike from the hotel to the lake and then to the peak and the return the same way. We did the loop and really enjoyed this beautiful hike.
No problem to leave the car behind if you go hiking.
To reach the village you need 4x4. But they're working at the road.

name: Riverside Camp
description: This riverside camp is a great place, you get some people that will walk through and picnic along the river, it is Kosovo, so it can get a little trashy. Otherwise it is one of the best places to stay here in Rugovë.

name: Autoservice Vali
description:
Car Workshop specialized on Landrovers.
I have been there twice already preparing my Defender for an Africa trip. 
The guys really know what they are doing.

name: Univers
description: Parked outside for the night, good WiFi reachable from the parking lot. Just outside the border on the Kosovo side. The place is a restaurant with decent food.

name: Serbien Kosovo Field
description: We parked on the Field as the grass has just been cut, however you can camp higher up next to Dirt road, but from the Field we had better mountain view and sunset. In the evening some locals came and were really friendly, gave us a bottle of “snapsch”. Three cars passed by and all nice people:)

name: Memorial wall
description: Memorial wall dedicated to the hundreds of thousands of ethnic Albanians expelled from Kosovo during the 1999 war. The memorial features: a mosaic of a refuge mother breast-feeding her daughter while fleeing her war-torn country, quotes from US and UK politicians, and the train engine and cars that were used to evacuate Albanian refugees to Macedonia.

name: Oda hostel
description:
This is your place in Pristina! Super nice vibe, clean and the owner, cpt Tony bring the customers all around the night to have fun! He is a biker too! 

Price 10€ night 
Parking inside for bikes 

+383 49 888 164

name: Motorbike Shop
description: Motorbike Shop for all brands.  Moto Meris phone 0044 486 108

name: Local border only
description: No International crossing. Only for locals!

name: Mirusha Falls
description: Mirusha Falls in the daytime some locals,  in the evening we are alone.  We heard it's 1 Euro for the night, but nobody ask us to pay.

name: Border
description: Coming from Albania we went from Kosovo to Serbia with EU ID card, was no problem at all and took us about 10 minutes. We passed the border on a Wednesday (~12 am).

name: Junik Camping
description:
Camp Junik is located at an altitude of 576m above sea level with a magnificent view over the city.
You are welcomed by a small family of parents with two children all talking
German and understand a little English

name: Noja Kuzhinë - Vegetarian Restaurant
description:
Nice restaurant, atmosphere with flair, very friend staff who speaks English and "Opa" as well German. 
The food is just delicious (only vegetarian meals) and we also could order some Falaffel plate which is not on the menu and the owner created it only for us ;)
Blues music was played (at least when we were there) - it fits to the atmosphere!
We really enjoyed our meal - we had soup, main dish and dessert with drinks!

name: Thesaret e Natyrës Restaurant
description: Restaurant at the 'Bear Sanctuary Pristina'. Delicous food for fair prices. Offers breakfast, lunch, dinner. Wifi available.

name: Kosovo/Albania Border - Qafë Morinë
description: We crossed from Albania to Kosovo. On the Albanian side they just waved us through. On the Kosovo side we had to get insurance sorted and then we could enter. Very friendly. Insurance for a moto was a minimum 15 days and was €10, cash only.

name: central parking
description: 1 Euro 2 hours with big Cars 1,5 Euro 2 hours. very friendly and safe. We pay 15 Euro for 22 hours . Its very central

name: Babaghanoush Restaurant (Vegan friendly)
description: good Restaurant falafel and Bowls. maybe you need a reservation for the evening

name: Green and protein
description: vegan and gluten-free friendly Fastfood. good and cheap food

name: parking
description: cheap car park 50cent/h close to old bazar.

name: Sky Hostel
description: Nice clean, modern hostel which is just a few minutes walk from the town centre. Dorm bed costs E12 per night. There’s room for a few motorbikes to park. See photo. Moderators - note that there isn’t an option to list this as being in Kosovo, just Serbia.

name: Laundromat - Speed Queen
description: Self-serve laundry. Ring the bell for remote entry.  One 18kg washer, two 9.5 kg washers, and two 16kg dryers.  Washers only take 1 euro coin (currently 4), and dryers take 1 or 2 euro coins as well as 50 cents.  Washers include soap.   Clean and well maintained.  Parking nearby.  Free fast wifi too

name: Prizren
description:
Huge unpaved and free parking spot in Prizren opposite IP Gas station - quiet at night and safe 
BUT TAKE CARE! on Wednesday morning this spot changes into a market place from 6-18 - you might be sent away on the edge of the spot but very gentle and helpful - other days of the week no problem to park.

name: Parking lot behind the hill
description: This is a parking lot for hikers to the mountains, but also used by locals to camp.  I am not sure if its legal, because there are some tentspaces which look like permanently used by some salesman. Flat area for tent spot is rare but doable. Two watertaps. In night bears can come to search food in containers. But we didnt hear or see them. The hill facing the village is used by a lot of wellnes searching people, the mountain air supposed to be very healthy.

name: Art Design
description: Really tasty and good value restaurant in central Peja / Pec - great local specialities!

name: Renaissance
description: Fantastic restaurant! No menu (they cook season food) but we paid 18Euro for a four course tasting menu and unlimited wine per person. Delicious food, fantastic setting and slightly nice average wine! Everyone should come here

name: Gryka Decanit
description: This a new campsite next to an established restaurant along the river. They are still finalising the facilities, but we were able to stay the night. There is a large open field for camping with beautiful views and surroundings. Access to the field via a bridge and hill is not accessible to large vehicles and may require 4x4 in wet weather. We were able to use the toilet and shower in the guesthouse they are currently renovating - not sure what will be available to campers in the future. There is a restaurant on site. The campsite and restaurant is further along the road from the Monastery Visoki Decani. You do have to drive through the secured area (for the monastery) but the guards just wave you through unless you want to visit the monastery (in which case you will need to provide passports to the guards at the entrance). The host and his family were super friendly and welcoming. Once they finish the current work the place will be fantastic! Highly recommend!

name: Behind a cafe in Radavac
description: We came off the steep descent from the border and asked this cafe owner if we could park in his parking lot behind his cafe.  He said yes, no problem and was very friendly.  We had a good night, some road noise until it got dark but otherwise fine.

name: GOT Prishtina Hostel
description: Fantastic hostel with safe parking for motos. Dorms and private rooms. Very friendly family running the place, and they keep the hostel clean and comfortable. A real home away from home!

name: Bora Hostel Tent Camping
description:
Though this is officially a hostel they  have a small patch of green area that can take some tents. There are some trees but not big enough to provide adequate shade from all sides. The hostel is situated in a hidden area and the green area is surrounded by walls which in a way may provide some shelter from wind. 

The owners are super friendly. I've paid €6 per night and I had access to all amenities including the kitchen. You may was you clothes for €3.

name: Pump house
description: Great spot in the woods. There is a water pump house (no noise) and a flat spot out front. Road in is short but 4x4 required. Breakfast included if you hit it in blackberry season…tons of bushes to pick from.
